[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [Null byte injection] Can attackers inject null bytes into the referer header to truncate string comparison early and bypass blocklist matching? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [Control character injection] Can attackers inject control characters (newlines, carriage returns, tabs) into referer values to manipulate parsing or logging behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [Overlong UTF-8 encoding] Can attackers use overlong UTF-8 sequences to represent blocked characters differently and bypass string matching in the ListManager? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [IDNA mapping bypass] Can attackers exploit differences between Unicode IDNA2003 and IDNA2008 mappings to create domain variants that bypass blocklisting? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [ListManager performance DoS] Does the ListManager.contains() operation scale linearly with blocklist size, allowing attackers to cause performance degradation by triggering checks when the blocklist is extremely large? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [ListManager hash collision] If ListManager uses a HashSet, can attackers craft referer values that cause hash collisions, leading to false negatives where blocked referers aren't detected? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: new()] [ListManager empty set] Does the checker handle the case where ListManager loads zero items properly, or could an empty blocklist file cause unexpected behavior or bypass all blocking? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: new()] [ListManager duplicate entries] Does ListManager handle duplicate entries in the blocklist file correctly, or could duplicates cause memory bloat or unexpected matching behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [ListManager concurrent modification] Is the ListManager's items HashSet protected against concurrent reads during checking operations, or can race conditions occur if the blocklist is reloaded while checks are in progress? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [Async race condition] Does the async check() method properly synchronize access to the shared ListManager, or can concurrent requests lead to race conditions when accessing the blocklist? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Struct: RefererBlocklistChecker] [Memory ordering] Does the RefererBlocklistChecker ensure proper memory ordering when accessed from multiple threads, or can weak memory models lead to seeing stale or inconsistent blocklist data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [Arc/reference counting] If RefererBlocklistChecker is wrapped in Arc for sharing, are there reference counting vulnerabilities or deadlocks when multiple async tasks hold references? (Low)

(Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [Error format injection] Can attackers inject format string specifiers or special characters into the referer that get unsafely interpolated into the error message, potentially causing logging vulnerabilities? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [Timing side channel] Does the contains() check take consistent time regardless of match result, or can attackers use timing attacks to probe whether specific referers are in the blocklist? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [Log injection via referer] Can attackers inject newlines or control characters in the referer that corrupt log files when the rejection message is logged, potentially hiding their activities? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-faucet/core/src/checkers/referer_blocklist.rs] [Function: check()] [Dry run bypass] The _dry_run parameter is unused in the implementation - can attackers exploit this to bypass intended dry-run protections or testing behavior? (Low)
